Simplified function

Solve approach

To solve $E_{curve}$, we need , and $b_i$ for each $e_i$.

For $b_i$, we are basically try to learn it from data, so that it is a data-driven bias, that can encode style of the input dataset while we are reconstructing the surface.

For and , they are used for compute the weighted laplacian. And I think we have two different approaches to get these values.

direct inferring

As Nathan described in the meeting, because we can also get this values from ground truth, we can also try to learn it from data. I put some initial results at

https://www.cs.ubc.ca/~ichaos/research/nbview/gt-laplacian-and-weights-results.html

The results looks perfect, but I am still trying to figure out why I donâ€™t even provide a positional constraint.

alternative optimization

I can also use alternative optimization method, that only take inferred bias as known, and alternatively optimize the weights and $e_i$.

https://www.cs.ubc.ca/~ichaos/research/nbview/alt-opt-circle-comparison.html
